reasoning: Well-defined schema modifications to 2 files with explicit specifications. No external integrations to research, no infrastructure setup, and straightforward Prisma/TypeScript changes following existing patterns.

scope.notes: Changes isolated to prisma/schema.prisma and src/types.ts. Other dependent code updates are out of scope for this task.

integrations.notes: Evolution API types are clearly specified in requirements. No API research needed - just defining types.

infrastructure.notes: Prisma schema changes require 'npx prisma generate' after modification. No actual database migration needed for this definition phase.

knowledge.notes: Existing Prisma schema provides clear patterns. TypeScript interfaces follow standard patterns already in types.ts.

concerns: Schema changes will break existing Instance queries until related code is updated
InstanceState enum change affects state handling logic
risk.notes: Risk is contained since this is just the schema/types definition phase. Dependent code updates are separate tasks.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Schema and type definitions are low-risk. Validation should confirm Prisma generates successfully and TypeScript compiles. No security-sensitive code changes - API keys are just field definitions, not credential handling.
